StringListProperty.Name: AdditionalDependencies
StringListProperty.Description: Specifies additional items to add to the link command line. [i.e. kernel32.lib]

StringListProperty.Name: AdditionalLibraryDirectories
StringListProperty.Description: Allows the user to override the environmental library path. (/LIBPATH:folder)

StringProperty.Name: OutputFile
StringProperty.Description: The /OUT option overrides the default name and location of the program that the linker creates.

BoolProperty.Name: SuppressStartupBanner
BoolProperty.Description: The /NOLOGO option prevents display of the copyright message and version number.

EnumValue.Name: NativeWASM
EnumValue.Description: Use native binary wasm support in the browser.

EnumValue.Name: InterpretSExpr
EnumValue.Description: Load a .wast, which contains wasm in s-expression format, and interpret it.

EnumValue.Name: InterpretBinary
EnumValue.Description: Load a .wasm, which contains wasm in binary format, and interpret it.

EnumValue.Name: InterpretAsm2Wasm
EnumValue.Description: Load .asm.js, compile to wasm on the fly, and interpret that.

EnumValue.Name: AsmJS
EnumValue.Description: Load .asm.js and just run it, no wasm. Useful for comparisons, or as a fallback for browsers without WebAssembly support.

EnumValue.Name: FileName
EnumValue.Description: Show just file name.

EnumValue.Name: CommandLineEMCC
EnumValue.Description: Show executing emcc command line.

EnumValue.Name: CommandLineEMBuild
EnumValue.Description: Show executing embuild command line.

EnumProperty.Name: DebugInformationFormat
EnumProperty.Description: Specifies the type of debugging information generated by the compiler. This requires compatible linker settings. (/Z7, /Zi, /ZI)

EnumValue.Name: None
EnumValue.Description: Make no effort to keep code debuggable. Will discard LLVM debug information (this is done by default in -01 and higher).

EnumValue.Name: Whitespace
EnumValue.Description: Preserve whitespace (do not minify).

EnumValue.Name: Function
EnumValue.Description: Preserve function names.

EnumValue.Name: Variable
EnumValue.Description: Preserve variable names.

EnumValue.Name: Max
EnumValue.Description: Preserve LLVM debug information. This is the highest level of debuggability. If -g was used when compiling the C/C++ sources, this shows line number debug comments, and generates source maps.

EnumProperty.Name: Optimization
EnumProperty.Description: Select option for code optimization; choose Custom to use specific optimization options. (/O0, /O1, /O2, /O3, /Os, /Oz)

EnumValue.Name: Custom
EnumValue.Description: Custom Optimization

EnumValue.Name: Disabled
EnumValue.Description: No optimizations (default). This is the recommended setting for starting to port a project, as it includes various assertions.

EnumValue.Name: Simple
EnumValue.Description: Simple optimizations. These include using asm.js, LLVM -O1 optimizations, relooping, removing runtime assertions and C++ exception catching, and enabling -s ALIASING_FUNCTION_POINTERS=1. This is the recommended setting when you want a reasonably optimized build that is generated as quickly as possible (it builds much faster than -O2).

EnumValue.Name: JS2
EnumValue.Description: Like -O1, but with various JavaScript-level optimizations and LLVM -O3 optimizations.

EnumValue.Name: JS3
EnumValue.Description: Like -O2, but with additional JavaScript optimizations that can take a significant amount of compilation time.

EnumValue.Name: MinSpace
EnumValue.Description: Like -O3, but with extra optimizations that reduce code size at the expense of performance. This can effect both bitcode generation and JavaScript.

EnumValue.Name: MaxSpeed
EnumValue.Description: Like -Os, but reduces code size even further. This can effect both bitcode generation and JavaScript.
